content.question: The particle diagram above represents an aqueous solution of a weak monoprotic acid. The white circles represent <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms. Which of the following shows the species that act as a Br√∏nsted-Lowry base and its conjugate acid, in that order, in the solution?

choices.label: The figure presents two species: the first is a gray circle with a small white circle attached to it. The second is a black circle with three small white circles attached to it.
The figure presents two species: the first is a gray circle with nothing attached to it. The second is a black circle with two small white circles attached to it.
The figure presents two species: the first is a black circle with two small white circles attached to it. The second is a black circle with one small white circle attached to it.
The figure presents two species: the first is a black circle with two small white circles attached to it. The second is a black circle with three small white circles attached to it.

content.answer: The figure presents two species: the first is a black circle with two small white circles attached to it. The second is a black circle with three small white circles attached to it.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
